reviews.title: What a gem!
reviews.text: Four of us spent 2 days and nights in Kobarid at the Hvala Hotel. I can't say enough good things about the hotel, the service, the view, and the most wonderful breakfast table I have ever seen in a hotel. They offered mouth-watering pastries and strudel, fresh fruit, meat, cheese, scrambled eggs with ham, muesli and granola, fresh breads - we were absolutely amazed! We also ate at their restaurant and the food and service was first class! I can see why Italians cross the border to eat there.

The staff was cheerful, attentive and helpful, and the rooms were delightful. Our little balcony overlooked the charming main street of Kobarid. If you go there, be sure to take the historic walk, especially to the Slap Kozjak (waterfall). The water in the Soca River is the most incredible green blue color. You can get the map at the hotel.
reviews.title: off the beaten track

reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at the Hvala in August, 2007. The quality of the room, the service, and especially the food was way above average. It was also less expensive than Bled or Ljubljana. I would certainly opt for this place off the beaten track for a great Slovenia experience. Easy one day drive to either Bled or Ljubljana or the Julian Alps. Marvelous WWI museum. You won't meet a lot of American touists here. Everyone speaks English.
